page.title: 08Warsop Fire Station.
page.content:
The fire station was built in{1972}on the site of a demolished farm alongside the A60 road in the village. The station is only manned when there is an emergency or for training sessions which are held regularly.All the firemen are "retained",that is, part-time volunteers,their main occupations being at local collieries or with British Rail.
There is only one fire engine.
During{the past year}there have been {144}call-outs,the majority to fires in buildings,grassland or heathland fires and chimney fires.Unfortunately there were 16 malicious calls. Assistance was given to other stations on 7 occasions.
